text:
We have an SVG document stored in an org.w3c.dom.Document. This document must 
be converted to an SVGDocument for use with the SVGCanvas. To do this we use 
SVGDocument.importNode(Node, boolean). However, importNode() does not 
duplicate the attributes on the elements. Line 221 is where the problem is. 
There a check is made if Element e has any attributes. Element e does not as 
it was just created. What should to be checked is the specified importedNode.

This problem also exists in v1.1.1.
creator: Mike_Buck@mapinfo.com
nicolas.socheleau@bitflash.com
text:
Previoulsy importNode was not checking the imported ELEMENT_NODE to see if it 
has attributed. THis is fixed in revision 1.16 of 
org/apache/batik/dom/AbstractDocument.java

230c230
<                 if (e.hasAttributes()) {
---
>                 if (importedNode.hasAttributes()) {
